title: Can only diamonds cut diamonds? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. A laser can cut diamonds too. The process of taking a rough diamond and turing it into a polished gemstone is generally referred to as “cutting” but involves several processes which might include: Cleaving - splitting the diamond into two pieces, usually with a steel blade and a hammer.Cutting - with a diamond saw or laser.Faceting - grinding away areas of the diamond on a metal wheel with diamond dust, to form flat surfaces.Bruting - forming a round girdle by rotating two diamonds against each other.Polishing - applying a fine finish to the facets using a polishing wheel and fine diamond dust.
